summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, transmitting witness materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell for her access in connection with her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center to whom witness materials are being provided for her criminal case.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter transmitting materials to Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Williams, as the U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor in the criminal case against defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Transmission of Witness Materials to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends witness materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center for her access in her criminal case.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, Southern District of New York, The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a formal letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office dated November 6, 2021.
It confirms Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn under case number 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
The purpose is to provide Maxwell with access to witness materials pertinent to her criminal case.
Damian Williams was the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at that time.
